newsitem.title: GREECE: Bank/Greece says will not hold 14-day depo tender.
newsitem.headline: Bank/Greece says will not hold 14-day depo tender.

text.p: The Bank of Greece said it would not hold its regular 14-day depo tender on Wednesday, resulting in a 50 billion drachma injection to market liquidity.
"The Bank of Greece announces it will not conduct on Wednesday 30 July 1997 a 14-day fixed rate tender, thus leaving 50 billion drachmas of additional liquidity to the market," it said.
The Bank of Greece cut its basic and floor depo facility rates by 30 basis points to 11.60 percent and 9.60 percent last Friday.
It had drained a net amount of 40 billion drachmas at 11.90 percent two days earlier.
